domo.educational.advancedmechanisms

Class SensorWithInner

  • java.lang.Object
    • domo.educational.advancedmechanisms.SensorWithInner

  • public class SensorWithInner
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Stefano Falzaresi Stefano.Falzaresi2@studio.unibo.it SensorWithInner contains an example of an "inner class" if compared with the example of the nested class we can see some differences, scope of variable is the same but, because "ResettableSensor" is a not static element inside another class it doesn't need a constructor, and it's instantiated with a public method "createResettable" in the outer class. In the methods of Resettable Sensor "super" is not used because ResettableSensor is enclosed in SensorWithInner so the inner class can access all the variables of the outer with "Outer.this.xxx" (in our case SensorWithInner.this.xxx)
